title: Inconsistent Behavior when Manipulating Source in Browsing Perspective
description: Users have reported an inconsistency in the behavior when manipulating source in the type hierarchy and the method list of the browser perspective.
OB:
When performing the following actions from the user's perspective:
1. Open Java Browsing Perspective.
2. Select a type.
3. Select a method in the method list view.
4. Delete the method using the context menu in the method list view.
   - The editor becomes dirty as expected.
5. Select another type.
6. Open the type hierarchy on this type and dock the hierarchy view.
7. Select a method in the method list view.
8. Select the same method in the hierarchy view.
9. Delete the method using the context menu in the hierarchy view.
   - The method is deleted on the file system.
   - The type list view, method list view, and editor are all cleared.

Note: This issue is not observed when the editor is already in a dirty state.
EB: The expected behavior is that, regardless of the editor's state, users should experience consistent results when manipulating source in the type hierarchy and the method list of the browser perspective.
